job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: Job Description:Â Our work depends on a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) joining our team to support the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) activities in Columbia, MD. As an SRE supporting CMS, the candidate will be trusted to work on the development, analysis and use of monitoring tools and data visualization from multiple sources to proactively ensure the day-to-day Enterprise Portal infrastructure health in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud environment and on physical data centers.Â Job Responsibilities:Supporting Portal 24/7 operations, and providing on-call support as neededTroubleshooting anomalies as part of Portal system reliabilityIntegrating new data sources to enhance the Portal infrastructure monitoring toolSupporting the development of new visual aids and enhancing existing visual aids to improve early detection of infrastructure anomaliesImproving the performance of existing and new monitoring toolsSupporting the troubleshooting activities to identify the root cause of infrastructure anomalies in a timely mannerEnsuring the systemâs high availabilityMaintaining required Service Level Agreements (SLA)Â Job Requirements:Bachelorâs degree in computer science, information systems, related field, or equivalent experience.4+ years of experience supporting a 24x7 Internet-oriented production environment, preferably across multiple data centers, involving at least hundreds of serversProficiency in scripting with Python, Perl, or shellThorough understanding of fundamental internet protocols such as DNS, HTTP, and TCPProven experience in various website/infrastructure monitoring tools, such as Chartbeat, ExtraHop, NewRelic, Dynatrace and SplunkFamiliarity with common open-source infrastructure toolsExperience with common networking equipment (Cisco, Juniper, F5, etc.)Strong understanding of networking protocolsExperience in fast paced Agile environments using Scrum/KanbanExperience in DevOps and Continuous Integration/Continuous Development (CI/CD)Â Preferred Qualifications:AWS experience using AWS FedRampAWS System Administration certification(s)SAFe certification(s)CMS or Health Care Industry experienceExperience utilizing Scrum/Kanban methodologiesExperience using JIRAProven oral and written skills to communicate with external and internal stakeholders effectively
